revision.text:
[[File:Muscle reading example.png|thumb|An example of muscle reading.]] '''Muscle reading''', also known as "[[Axel Hellstrom|Hellstromism]]", "Cumberlandism" or "contact mind reading", is a technique used by [[Mentalism|mentalists]] to determine the thoughts or knowledge of a subject, the effect of which tends to be perceived as a form of [[Telepathy|mind reading]]. The performer can determine many things about the mental state of a subject by observing subtle, involuntary responses to speech or any other stimuli.<ref>[[Milbourne Christopher|Christopher, Milbourne]]. (1996). ''The Illustrated History of Magic''. Greenwood Publishing Group. p. 389</ref><ref>[[Martin Gardner|Gardner Martin]]. (2012 edition, originally published in 1957). ''[[Fads and Fallacies in the Name of Science]]''. Dover Publications. {{ISBN|0-486-20394-8}} "The unwitting translation of thoughts into muscular action is one of the most firmly established facts of psychology. In individuals particularly prone to it, it is responsible for such "occult" phenomena as the movement of a Ouija board, table tipping, and automatic writing. It is the basis of a type of mind reading known in the magic profession as "muscle reading." Someone hides a pin in a room, and the performer finds it quickly by having a spectator take hold of his hand. The spectator thinks he is being led by the magician, but actually the performer permits the spectator to lead him by unconscious muscular tensions. Many famous muscle readers are able to dispense with bodily contact altogether, finding the hidden object merely by observing the reactions of spectators in the room."</ref> It is closely related to the [[ideomotor effect]], whereby subtle movements made without conscious awareness reflect a physical movement, action or direction which the subject is thinking about. The term "muscle reading" was coined in the 1870s by American neurologist [[George M. Beard]] to describe the actions of mentalist [[J. Randall Brown]], an early proponent of the art.<ref>{{Cite book | last = Jay | first = Ricky | authorlink = Ricky Jay | title = Learned Pigs and Fireproof Women | publisher = [[Villard Books]] | year = 1986 | location = New York City | pages = 175 | url = https://books.google.com/books?id=-HHYAAAAMAAJ | isbn = }}</ref><ref>[[Simon During|During, Simon]]. (2004). ''Modern Enchantments: The Cultural Power of Secular Magic''. Harvard University Press. p. 162. {{ISBN|978-0674013711}}</ref>
== History ==
Muscle reading is also known by the names of those who have used it in popular performances. The success of one early performer, [[Stuart Cumberland]], led to the technique's alternate name of Cumberlandism. The fame of the [[mentalist]] [[Axel Hellstrom]] led to it widely being called Hellstromism. Performers such as [[J. Randall Brown]], [[Erik Jan Hanussen]], [[Franz Polgar]], and [[Kreskin]] have also used muscle reading successfully in their acts.
In 1924, magician [[Carl Hertz]] noted that "mind-reading is nothing but muscle-reading. In all the cases where the mind-reader is supposed to lead a person to a hidden object, the spectator is guided entirely by an involuntary movement of the subject's muscles."<ref>[[Carl Hertz|Hertz, Carl]]. (1924). ''A Modern Mystery Merchant''. Hutchinson & Company. p. 277</ref> The mentalist [[Washington Irving Bishop]] could drive a car blindfolded by muscle reading techniques.<ref>Neher, Andrew. (2011). ''Paranormal and Transcendental Experience: A Psychological Examination''. Dover Publications. p. 33. {{ISBN|0-486-26167-0}} "Washington Irving Bishop could drive blindfolded through city streets, guided by the involuntary muscle reactions of a passenger who placed his hand on Bishop. In addition, Bishop could drive to a location anywhere in the city where his passenger had hidden an object and, still through reading his guide's muscle reactions, would locate the object in its hiding place."</ref>
Kreskin, one of the most accomplished performers of muscle reading in modern times, can tell a driver where to go in a car while a subject holds his wrist (or vice versa). In one of his books he relates the technique to the children's game within which a hidden object is located by feedback of "hot" or "cold".
[[June Downey]] had studied the practice of muscle reading from a psychological perspective.<ref>Roeckelein, Jon E. (2004). ''Imagery in Psychology: A Reference Guide''. Praeger. p. 238. {{ISBN|0-313-32197-3}}</ref> She has been described as an expert on the subject of muscle reading.<ref>[http://www.apadivisions.org/division-35/about/heritage/june-downey-biography.aspx "June Etta Downey (1875-1932)"]. Society for the Psychology of Women.</ref>
== Technique ==
The technique relies on the assertion that the subject will subconsciously reveal their thoughts through very slight involuntary physical reactions, also known as ideomotor responses. The performer can determine what the subject is thinking by recognising and interpreting those responses. Muscle reading may be billed by some entertainers as a [[psychic]] phenomenon, where the audience will be told that by creating physical contact with the subject, a better psychic connection can be formed. In fact, the contact allows the performer to read more subtle reactions in the subject's motor functions that may not be apparent without contact, such as muscle control and heart rate.
Because muscle reading relies so heavily on the subject's subconscious reactions to their environment and situation, this technique is used commonly when performing stunts dealing with locating objects in an auditorium or on stage, and as such, it can be done 'clean' by the magician skilled in [[Kinesics|reading body language]].
Performers often instruct the subject to imagine voicing instructions, which presumably amplifies the reactions of the subject, thus promoting the idea that the trick involves genuine thought tranference or mind-reading. However the subject who is "thinking directions" has a physical, kinaesthetic reaction that guides the performer so that he or she can, for example, locate a specific place on a wall on which to place a pin, without prior knowledge of where the pin should go.
Knowledge of muscle reading is a technique that is also reportedly used by poker players to hide their reactions to the game, as well as to read the other players for potential bluffs and/or better hands.
==See also==
*[[Billet reading]] *[[Cold reading]] *[[Ideomotor effect]]
==References== {{reflist}}
==Further reading== *[[George M. Beard]]. (1882). [https://archive.org/details/studyoftrancemus00bear ''The Study of Trance, Muscle-Reading and Allied Phenomena in Europe and America'']. New York. *[[H. J. Burlingame]]. (1891). [https://archive.org/stream/leavesfromconjur01burl#page/108/mode/2up ''Mind-Readers and Their Tricks'']. In ''Leaves from Conjurers' Scrap books: Or, Modern Magicians and Their Works''. Chicago: Donohue, Henneberry & Co. pp. 108-127 *[[June Downey]]. (1908). [https://archive.org/details/jstor-2011793 ''Automatic Phenomena of Muscle-Reading'']. ''[[The Journal of Philosophy]]'' 5: 650-658. *[[June Downey]]. (1909). ''Muscle-Reading: A Method of Investigating Involuntary Movements and Mental Types''. ''[[Psychological Review]]'' 16: 257-301.
==External links== *http://www.randi.org/encyclopedia/muscle%20reading.html - [[James Randi]] on the subject *http://dict.die.net/muscle%20reading/ - dictionary definition {{Magic and Illusion}}
[[Category:Magic tricks]] [[Category:Mentalism]]

revision.text:
{{Infobox radio station | image = RadioMarañón.png | last airdate = <!-- for defunct stations --> | format = | power = | class = | former_callsigns = | former_frequencies = | operator = | owner = [[Society of Jesus]] | licensee = | name = | image_size = <!-- optional when used with image parameter, specifies image size --> | alt = <!-- optional when used with image parameter, specifies image alternate (alt) text --> | caption = <!-- optional when used with image parameter, specifies image caption --> | city = 343 Calle Orellana, [[Jaén, Peru]] | area = Northern Peru: provinces of [[Jaén Province, Peru|Jaén]], [[Bagua Province|Bagua]], [[San Ignacio Province|San Ignacio]] | branding = | slogan = | frequency = | translator = | repeater = | airdate = | language = Spanish | erp = | haat = | facility_id = | coordinates = | callsign_meaning = | affiliations = | sister_stations = | webcast = | website = [http://www.radiomaranon.org.pe Radio Marañón] }}
'''Radio Marañón''' was founded by the [[Society of Jesus]] in 1976 to further the integral development of the people in northern [[Peru]]. It is headquartered in the [[Apostolic Vicariate of Jaén in Peru|Apostolic Vicariate of Jaén]] which is also administered by the [[Jesuits]], and is named for the chief source of the [[Amazon River]], the [[Marañón River]], which flows through [[Jaén Province, Peru|Jaén]].
==History== After 1985, the Educational Institute of Radio Marañón (INTERAMA) was created.<ref>{{Cite book|url=https://archive.org/details/LineaDeFormacionEInvestigacionDeAler|title=Linea de Formacion e Investigacion de ALER|last=Radionauta}}</ref>.
In 1994 it became a member of the Latin American Association of Radio Education,<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://sistema.aler.org/?q=afiliadas-sitio-web&field_afiliada_pais_tid=33|title=Nuestras Afiliadas {{!}} Sistema ALER|website=sistema.aler.org|access-date=2017-10-31}}</ref> and later of the [[World Association of Community Radio Broadcasters]]. During the repressive, right-leaning [[Alberto Fujimori|Fujimori]] 1990s, seven Radio Marañón journalists were threatened and one narrowly escaped death in an assassination attempt.<ref>{{Cite book|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=9VeI76JSJZAC&pg=PA147&lpg=PA147&dq=Radio+Mara%C3%B1%C3%B3n&source=bl&ots=M9k3f-5JRf&sig=kQTFTXi1rNY2vifLVdsAWgVwhy8&hl=en&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwi9hKSr45nXAhUFy2MKHRsDCFQ4PBDoAQg5MAM#v=onepage&q=Radio%20Mara%C3%B1%C3%B3n&f=false|title=World Report 2000|last=(Organization)|first=Human Rights Watch|last2=Staff|first2=Human Rights Watch|date=1999|publisher=Human Rights Watch|isbn=9781564322388|language=en}}</ref>
In 2001 FM Stereo Marañón 96.1 "Atrévete" was initiated as a commercial station.<ref name=":0" /> In 2003 the station was one of eight recipients of the Eloy Arribas award bestowed by Peru's National Radio Coordinator (CNR).<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www2.caretas.pe/2003/1794/articulos/cnr.html|title=CARETAS HOME PAGE|website=www2.caretas.pe|access-date=2017-10-31}}</ref> In 2005 CNR decried unjust charges against Francisco Muguiro Ibarra, director of Radio Marañón de Jaén, in which Panamericana Televisión accused him and several communal leaders of supporting a violent terrorist network because they defended local communities from the intrusion of foreign mining companies. CNR also mentioned Fr. Muguiro’s active participation in the Life and Peace National Campaign in the 1980s, when he received a death threat from the [[Shining Path]] communist party in Peru.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.servindi.org/actualidad/135|title=Perú: Rechazan acusaciones contra vicario apostólico y director de Radio Marañón {{!}} Servindi - Servicios de Comunicación Intercultural|website=www.servindi.org|language=es|access-date=2017-10-30}}</ref>
In 2011, the programming of FM and AM were unified with programs reaching both rural and urban areas.<ref name=":0">{{Cite web|url=http://www.radiomaranon.org.pe/index.php/institucional/historia|title=Historia - ::Radio Marañón::|last=Master|first=Web|website=www.radiomaranon.org.pe|language=es-es|access-date=2017-10-30}}</ref>
==References== {{Reflist|2}} {{Coord|5|42|34.07|S|78|48|42.05|W|display=title}}
[[Category:Jesuit development centres]] [[Category:Organizations established in 1976]] [[Category:Radio in Peru]]

revision.text:
In mathematics, the '''replicator equation''' is a deterministic monotone non-linear and non-innovative game dynamic used in [[evolutionary game theory]]. The replicator equation differs from other equations used to model replication, such as the [[quasispecies]] equation, in that it allows the [[fitness function]] to incorporate the distribution of the population types rather than setting the fitness of a particular type constant. This important property allows the replicator equation to capture the essence of [[Selection (biology)|selection]]. Unlike the quasispecies equation, the replicator equation does not incorporate [[mutation]] and so is not able to innovate new types or pure strategies.
== Equational forms ==
The most general continuous form is given by the [[differential equation]]
:<math> \dot{x_i} = x_i [ f_i(x) - \phi(x)], \quad \phi(x) = \sum_{j=1}^{n}{x_j f_j(x)}</math>
where <math>x_i</math> is the proportion of type <math> i </math> in the population, <math>x=(x_1, \ldots, x_n)</math> is the vector of the distribution of types in the population, <math>f_i(x)</math> is the fitness of type <math>i</math> (which is dependent on the population), and <math>\phi(x)</math> is the average population fitness (given by the weighted average of the fitness of the <math>n</math> types in the population). Since the elements of the population vector <math>x</math> sum to unity by definition, the equation is defined on the n-dimensional [[simplex]].
The replicator equation assumes a uniform population distribution; that is, it does not incorporate population structure into the fitness. The fitness landscape does incorporate the population distribution of types, in contrast to other similar equations, such as the quasispecies equation.
In application, populations are generally finite, making the discrete version more realistic. The analysis is more difficult and computationally intensive in the discrete formulation, so the continuous form is often used, although there are significant properties that are lost due to this smoothing. Note that the continuous form can be obtained from the discrete form by a [[limiting]] process.
To simplify analysis, fitness is often assumed to depend linearly upon the population distribution, which allows the replicator equation to be written in the form:
:<math>\dot{x_i}=x_i\left(\left(Ax\right)_i-x^TAx\right),</math>
where the [[payoff matrix]] <math>A</math> holds all the fitness information for the population: the expected payoff can be written as <math>\left(Ax\right)_i</math> and the mean fitness of the population as a whole can be written as <math>x^TAx</math>.
== Analysis ==
{{Main|Evolutionarily stable state}}
The analysis differs in the continuous and discrete cases: in the former, methods from differential equations are utilized, whereas in the latter the methods tend to be stochastic. Since the replicator equation is non-linear, an exact solution is difficult to obtain (even in simple versions of the continuous form) so the equation is usually analyzed in terms of stability. The replicator equation (in its continuous and discrete forms) satisfies the [[Folk theorem (game theory) | folk theorem]] of evolutionary game theory which characterizes the stability of equilibria of the equation. The solution of the equation is often given by the set of [[evolutionarily stable state]]s of the population.
In general nondegenerate cases, there can be at most one interior evolutionary stable state (ESS), though there can be many equilibria on the boundary of the simplex. All the faces of the simplex are forward-invariant which corresponds to the lack of innovation in the replicator equation: once a strategy becomes extinct there is no way to revive it.
Phase portrait solutions for the continuous linear-fitness replicator equation have been classified in the two and three dimensional cases. Classification is more difficult in higher dimensions because the number of distinct portraits increases rapidly.
== Relationships to other equations ==
The continuous replicator equation on <math>n</math> types is equivalent to the [[Generalized Lotka–Volterra equation]] in <math>n-1</math> dimensions. The transformation is made by the change of variables :<math>x_i = \frac{y_i}{1 + \sum_{j=1}^{n-1}{y_j}} \quad i=1, \ldots,n-1 </math> :<math>x_n = \frac{1}{1 + \sum_{j=1}^{n-1}{y_j}},</math> where <math>y_i</math> is the Lotka–Volterra variable.
The continuous replicator dynamic is also equivalent to the [[Price equation]] (see Page & Nowak's (2002) paper Unifying Evolutionary Dynamics).
== Generalizations ==
A generalization of the replicator equation which incorporates mutation is given by the replicator-mutator equation, which takes the following form in the continuous version:
:<math> \dot{x_i} = \sum_{j=1}^{n}{x_j f_j(x) Q_{ji}} - \phi(x)x_i, </math>
where the matrix <math>Q</math> gives the [[transition probabilities]] for the mutation of type <math>j</math> to type <math> i </math>. This equation is a simultaneous generalization of the replicator equation and the [[quasispecies]] equation, and is used in the mathematical analysis of language.
The replicator equation can easily be generalized to [[asymmetric games]]. A recent generalization that incorporates population structure is used in [[evolutionary graph theory]].
==References==
* [[Immanuel Bomze|Bomze, I.M.]] (1983) ''[https://pdfs.semanticscholar.org/9dc3/9c06088759b11d8c8ad359980c7cb175c36f.pdf Lotka-Volterra equations and replicator dynamics: A two dimensional classification].'' Biol. Cybern. 48:201-11. * [[Immanuel Bomze|Bomze, I.M.]] (1995) ''[http://bio.research.ucsc.edu/~barrylab/classes/game_theory/BomzeCorrections.pdf Lotka-Volterra equations and replicator dynamics: New issues in classification].'' Biol. Cybern. 72:447-53. * Cressman, R. (2003) ''[https://books.google.com/books?id=187BOmBvyvQC&printsec=frontcover#v=onepage&q=%22Replicator%20equation%22&f=false Evolutionary Dynamics and Extensive Form Games]'' The MIT Press. * Hofbauer, J., and [[Karl Sigmund|Sigmund, K.]] (2003) ''[http://www.ams.org/journals/bull/2003-40-04/S0273-0979-03-00988-1/S0273-0979-03-00988-1.pdf Evolutionary game dynamics]'' Bull. Am. Math. Soc. 40, 479-519. * [[Erez Lieberman|Lieberman, E.]], Hauert, C., & [[Martin Nowak|Nowak, M.]] (2005). Evolutionary dynamics on graphs. Nature, 433(7023), 312-316. * Page, K., and [[Martin Nowak|Nowak, M.]] (2002) ''Unifying Evolutionary Dynamics'' Journal of Theoretical Biology 219: 93-98 . * [[Martin Nowak|Nowak, M.]] (2006) ''Evolutionary Dynamics: Exploring the Equations of Life'' Belknap Press.
==External links==
* Izquierdo, S.S. & Izquierdo L.R. (2011). Online software: [http://demonstrations.wolfram.com/ReplicatorMutatorDynamicsWithThreeStrategies/ The Replicator-Mutator Dynamics with Three Strategies]
{{game theory}} [[Category:Game theory]] [[Category:Differential equations]] [[Category:Evolutionary game theory]] [[Category:Evolutionary dynamics]]

{{Infobox film | name = Rio | image = Rio2011Poster.jpg | alt = A blue Spix's macaw wearing a yellow scarf is surrounded by other birds and animals from the film. They sit on a sandy beach with beachgoing tourists in the background, facing away. The weather is mostly sunny, with one cloud in the sky. The text reads "From the creators of ''Ice Age'': RIO" | caption = Theatrical release poster | director = [[Carlos Saldanha]] | producer = Bruce Anderson
John C. Donkin | screenplay = [[Don Rhymer]]
[[Joshua Sternin]]
[[Jennifer Ventimilia|Jeffrey Ventimilia]]
[[Sam Harper]] | story = Carlos Saldanha
Earl Richey Jones
Todd Jones | starring = {{plainlist| * [[Jesse Eisenberg]] * [[Anne Hathaway]] * [[George Lopez]] * [[Jemaine Clement]] * [[Tracy Morgan]] * [[Leslie Mann]] * [[Will.i.am]] * [[Jamie Foxx]]}} | music = [[John Powell (composer)|John Powell]] | cinematography = Renato Falcão | editing = Harry Hitner | studio = [[Blue Sky Studios]]
[[20th Century Fox Animation]] | distributor = [[20th Century Fox]] | released = {{Film date|2011|3|22|World premiere|2011|4|15|North America|ref1=}} | runtime = 96 minutes | country = United States | language = English{{cite web|url=http://www.bbfc.co.uk/releases/rio-2011|website=BBFC|title=Rio (2011)|accessdate=November 14, 2017}} | budget = $90 million{{cite news |url=http://latimesblogs.latimes.com/entertainmentnewsbuzz/2011/04/box-office-rio-scream-4-conspirator.html |title=Movie Projector: 'Rio' should stifle 'Scream 4' |last=Kaufman |first=Amy |work=Los Angeles Times |publisher=Tribune Company |date=April 14, 2011 |accessdate=May 3, 2011}} | gross = $484.6 million | Successor = [[Rio 2]] }} '''''Rio''''' is a 2011 American [[3D film|3D]] [[Computer-animated film|computer-animated]] [[Adventure film|adventure]]-[[Comedy film|comedy]] film produced by [[Blue Sky Studios]] and directed by [[Carlos Saldanha]]. The title refers to the Brazilian city of [[Rio de Janeiro]], where the film is set. The film features the voices of [[Jesse Eisenberg]], [[Anne Hathaway]], [[Jemaine Clement]], [[Leslie Mann]], [[George Lopez]], and [[Jamie Foxx]]. It tells the story of Blu (Eisenberg), a male [[Spix's macaw]] who is taken to Rio de Janeiro to mate with a free-spirited female Spix's macaw, Jewel (Hathaway). The two eventually fall in love, and together they have to escape from being smuggled by Nigel (Clement), a cockatoo. The theme song, "Telling the World," was performed by [[Taio Cruz]]. Saldanha developed his first story concept of ''Rio'' in 1995, in which a penguin is washed up in Rio. Saldanha learned of the production of the films ''[[Happy Feet]]'' (2006) and ''[[Surf's Up (film)|Surf's Up]]'' (2007), and changed the concept to involve macaws and their environments in Rio. He proposed his idea to [[Chris Wedge]] in 2006, and the project was set up at Blue Sky. The main voice actors were approached in 2009. During production, the crew visited Rio de Janeiro and also consulted with an expert on macaws at the [[Bronx Zoo]] to study their movements. ''Rio'' premiered on March 22, 2011, in [[Lagoa, Rio de Janeiro]], and had its general release on April 15, 2011 in [[North America]], by [[20th Century Fox]]. The film received generally positive reviews from film critics. Observers praised the visuals, voice acting, and music. The film was also a box office success, grossing over $143 million in the United States and $484 million worldwide. The film was nominated for [[Academy Award]] for [[Academy Award for Best Original Song|Best Original Song]] for the song "Real in Rio", but lost to the other nominee, "[[Man or Muppet]]" from ''[[The Muppets (film)|The Muppets]]''.{{cite web |title=Nominees for the 84th Academy Awards |url=http://www.oscars.org/awards/academyawards/84/nominees.html |work=Oscars.org |accessdate=February 1, 2012 |date=January 24, 2012}} A sequel, ''[[Rio 2]]'', was released on April 11, 2014. ==Plot== In [[Brazil]], various exotic birds are smuggled out of the country. In [[Moose Lake, Minnesota]], a crate with a male [[Spix's macaw]] hatchling falls out of a truck and is found by a little girl named Linda Gunderson, who names him Blu. Over the next 15 years, Linda comes to own a bookstore. Highly domesticated and unable to fly because he is scared to, Blu is ridiculed frequently by the [[Canada goose|Canada geese]] that come by outside of Linda's bookstore. One day, [[ornithology|ornithologist]] Túlio Monteiro invites Blu and Linda to [[Rio de Janeiro]] because Blu, who is the last known male of his species, needs to mate with the last known female macaw. Linda accepts and they fly to Rio, where Blu meets a [[red-crested cardinal]] named Pedro and his [[yellow canary]] friend Nico. At Túlio's [[aviary]], Blu meets Jewel, a fiercely independent [[Spix's macaw]] longing to flee back to the wilderness. The macaws are captured by Fernando, an orphaned boy, and a [[sulphur-crested cockatoo]] named Nigel, both of whom work for a group of smugglers led by Marcel, who wants to leave the country as soon as possible to secure a black market deal regarding Blu and Jewel. While Fernando has second thoughts about his actions, Nigel tells the macaws that he desires to exact revenge on "pretty birds" after his role on a television program had been ruined by one. However, because of Blu's familiarity with cages, they flee into the jungle. Fernando meets Linda and Túlio and helps them find the birds, while Blu and Jewel meet Rafael, a [[toco toucan]], who offers to take them to his friend, Luiz, to remove their leg chain. He attempts to teach Blu how to fly, before they meet up with Pedro and Nico. Meanwhile, Nigel hires a horde of thieving [[marmoset]]s led by Mauro to capture Blu and Jewel. Pedro and Nico then take the two birds to a Rio-style dance party, where they perform a duet and begin to fall in love, but encounter the marmosets in the process. The birds fight them off while the five escape on a [[tram]]. Fernando takes Linda and Túlio to the smugglers' hideout, where they discover that the birds have already been moved out. Marcel explains that he will use the [[Rio Carnival]] parade to smuggle the birds to the airport, as the other streets have been blocked off for the festivities. Meanwhile, Blu and the others meet Luiz, who is a [[bulldog]], who releases the chain holding Blu and Jewel. After the two get into a heated argument, they decide to go their separate ways. Pedro and Nico then witness Nigel capturing Jewel. When Blu and Rafael learn of it, they rush to the carnival to rescue her. Meanwhile, Linda and Túlio have spotted the smuggler's parade float and organize a rescue attempt for the birds. As Linda and Túlio pose as dancers in [[Spix's macaw]] costumes, Nigel captures Blu and the group. Linda and Túlio are unable to stop the smugglers in time and Marcel's group takes off in a [[Short SC.7 Skyvan]]. During the flight, Blu destroys his cage using a fire extinguisher and releases the other captive birds. However, Nigel attacks the macaws, injuring Jewel. Blu sends Nigel flying into the plane's engine using the fire extinguisher, causing the plane to fall. The smugglers flee the plane. Unable to fly, Jewel falls out of the plane's open cargo hatch towards the ocean. Jumping out of the plane to rescue her, Blu finally discovers that he is able to fly as he and Jewel kiss, and he carries her to Linda and Túlio for help. Later, they adopt Fernando and organize a sanctuary to protect the jungle from smugglers. Blu and Jewel eventually raise three children together, and fly above the jungle, joined by Linda, Luiz, and Túlio in a hang-glider. Meanwhile, Nigel survives the plane crash but is ridiculed for his loss of feathers by Mauro, and the smugglers are sent to prison. ==Voice cast== * [[Jesse Eisenberg]] as Blu, a male [[Spix's macaw]]{{cite news |title=The Real "Rio": True Story of a Spix's Macaw |url=http://www.dailykos.com/story/2012/02/15/1065030/-The-Real-Rio-True-Story-of-a-Spix-s-Macaw |accessdate=May 20, 2012 |newspaper=Daily Kos |date=February 15, 2012}} who was born in Rio de Janeiro but raised in [[Moose Lake, Minnesota]]. * [[Anne Hathaway]] as Jewel, a female Spix's macaw from Rio de Janeiro. * [[Leslie Mann]] as Linda Gunderson, a girl who discovered Blu after he was taken from Rio de Janeiro to Moose Lake and adopted him for 15 years. * [[Jemaine Clement]] as Nigel, a sadistic [[sulphur-crested cockatoo]]. * [[Rodrigo Santoro]] as Dr. Túlio Monteiro, a Brazilian ornithologist. Santoro also voices a Soccer Announcer. * [[George Lopez]] as Rafael, a romantic [[toco toucan]] fond of Carnival. * [[Will.i.am]] as Pedro, a [[red-crested cardinal]] who is Nico's best friend. * [[Jamie Foxx]] as Nico, a [[yellow canary]] who loves to [[samba]], and whose bottlecap hat functions as a tambourine. * [[Jake T. Austin]] as Fernando, Marcel's impoverished young assistant. * [[Tracy Morgan]] as Luiz, a [[bulldog]] who is Rafael's friend and a [[chainsaw]] expert who has a medical condition of drooling. * [[Carlos Ponce]] as Marcel, Nigel's owner and the leader of a group of exotic bird smugglers. * [[Jeffrey Garcia]] as Tipa/Short-Tailed Bat. * Davi Vieira as Armando, one of Marcel's minions alongside Tipa. * [[Bebel Gilberto]] as Eva, a [[keel-billed toucan]] and Rafael's wife. * Bernardo de Paula as Kipo, a [[roseate spoonbill]], and Sylvio, the security guard at Túlio's aviary. * Francisco Ramos as Mauro, the leader of the [[marmoset]]s. * [[Wanda Sykes]] as Chloe, a [[Canada goose]] who is Alice's sister. * [[Jane Lynch]] as Alice, a [[Canada goose]] who is Chloe's sister. ==Production== Saldanha first had the idea for the film in 1995, involving a penguin being washed up on the beaches of Ipanema; it was changed to the current story after he learned of ''[[Happy Feet]]'' and ''[[Surf's Up (film)|Surf's Up]]'' (two other films involving penguins) being produced. He pitched the idea to Chris Wedge at Blue Sky in 2006.{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/culture/film/8398693/Rio-Brazilian-rhapsody.html |title=Rio: Brazilian rhapsody |first=Craig |last=McLean |work=The Daily Telegraph |location=UK |date=March 28, 2011 |issn=0307-1235 |oclc=49632006 |accessdate=May 1, 2011}} Saldanha showed the animators maps and books with geographic landmarks and measurements, from which they built a digital version of Rio. Later, a group of artists from the company visited Rio to see the various story locations.{{cite web |url=http://www.mb.com.ph/articles/312336/rio-director-pays-homage-hometown-with-new-animated-movie |title='Rio' director pays homage to hometown with new animated movie |first=Annie |last=Alejo |work=Manila Bulletin |date=April 1, 2011 |accessdate=May 1, 2011}} The animators also met with an expert on macaws at the [[Bronx Zoo]] to gain insight into their movement and personalities.{{cite news |url=https://blogs.wsj.com/speakeasy/2011/04/14/director-carlos-saldanha-returns-home-with-rio/?mod=google_news_blog |title=Director Carlos Saldanha Returns Home with 'Rio' |work=The Wall Street Journal |date=April 14, 2011 |accessdate=May 1, 2011 |first=Julie |last=Steinberg}} Saldanha himself is a Brazilian from Rio de Janeiro; such elements of Brazilian culture and landmarks were also influenced from Saldanha growing up in Brazil. The lead voice actors were approached in 2009. Jemaine Clement was approached to do the film after seeing test shots of his character Nigel doing a speech from ''[[Flight of the Conchords]]'',{{cite web |url=http://www.stuff.co.nz/dominion-post/arts-life/4857420/Another-feather-in-his-cap |title=Another feather in his cap |first=Tom |last=Cardy |work=Stuff.co.nz |date=April 7, 2011 |accessdate=May 1, 2011}} which was done prior to a script being finalized.{{cite web |url=http://www.thisisfakediy.co.uk/articles/film/interview-jemaine-clement |title=Interview: Jemaine Clement|work=ThisIsFakeDIY.co.uk |date=March 30, 2011 |accessdate=May 1, 2011}} [[Neil Patrick Harris]] was supposed to voice Blu, but had other commitments outside production; he was later replaced by [[Jesse Eisenberg]]. Eisenberg was asked during the filming of ''[[The Social Network]]'' if he would do his voice recording on the weekends, and he agreed after reading the script, saying: "It was the perfect antidote to get out of the mindset of my character in ''Social Network'' who was so severe, and in some ways so joyless."{{cite news |url=https://blogs.wsj.com/speakeasy/2011/04/15/jesse-eisenberg-goes-from-facebook-to-rio |title=Jesse Eisenberg Goes from Facebook to 'Rio' |work=The Wall Street Journal |date=April 15, 2011 |accessdate=May 1, 2011 |first=Julie |last=Steinberg}} For music, they brought on board [[Sérgio Mendes]] to act as music guru and online living library. He in turn was able to reach out to artists such as will.i.am and [[Carlinhos Brown]] to provide music for the film.{{cite news |url=http://articles.boston.com/2011-04-10/ae/29404021_1_rio-fox-animation-division-ice-age |title='Ice Age' team goes to 'Rio' |first=Tom |last=Russo |work=Articles.Boston.com |date=April 11, 2011 |accessdate=May 1, 2011}} Eisenberg and Anne Hathaway, who voiced Jewel, had acted together before when both were still teenagers, when they played siblings in the short-lived 1999 TV show ''[[Get Real (U.S. TV series)|Get Real]]''. Hathaway stated in an interview that she didn't see Eisenberg during production of ''Rio'' except "socially throughout the process," but that she was "very happy for all of his success."{{cite web |last=Murray |first=Rebecca |title=Inside 'Rio' with Anne Hathaway, Jamie Foxx, and George Lopez |url=http://movies.about.com/od/rio/a/rio-cast-interview.htm |work=About.com |accessdate=September 16, 2011 |date=January 28, 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110916205908/http://movies.about.com/od/rio/a/rio-cast-interview.htm |archivedate=September 16, 2011 |df=mdy-all }} ==Music== ===Soundtrack=== {{Infobox album | name = Rio: Music from the Motion Picture | type = [[Soundtrack]] | artist = Various Artists | cover = | alt = | released = {{Start date|2011|03|29}} {{small|(Digital download)}}
April 5, 2011 {{small|(Audio CD)}} | recorded = | venue = | studio = | genre = [[Pop music|Pop]], [[Latin music (genre)|Latin]], [[alternative hip hop]] | length = 38:11 | label = [[Interscope Records|Interscope]], [[will.i.am Music Group]] | producer = [[Sérgio Mendes]], [[John Powell (composer)|John Powell]] | chronology = [[Blue Sky Studios]] film soundtrack | prev_title = [[Ice Age: Dawn of the Dinosaurs]] | prev_year = 2009 | next_title = [[Ice Age: Continental Drift]] | next_year = 2012 | misc = {{Singles | name = Rio: Music from the Motion Picture | type = Soundtrack | single1 = [[Telling the World]] | single1date = March 22, 2011 }} }} On March 18, 2011, [[Brazilians in the United Kingdom|Brazilian-English]] singer-songwriter [[Taio Cruz]] released a music video and theme song named "Telling the World" on YouTube for the soundtrack.{{cite web |title=Telling the World (From the Soundtrack to "RIO" the Movie) |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4JK_Lg8P7PU |publisher=YouTube |accessdate=September 16, 2011 |author=TaioCruzVEVO |date=March 18, 2011}} ''Rio: Music from the Motion Picture'' was released in the United States by 20th Century Fox on March 29, 2011, for [[Music download|digital download]]{{cite web |title=Rio: Music From The Motion Picture |url=https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B004SF30HI |publisher=Amazon.com |accessdate=September 16, 2011}} and by [[Interscope Records]] on April 5, 2011, in Audio CD format.{{cite web |title=Rio: Music From the Motion Picture [Soundtrack] |url=https://www.amazon.com/Rio-Motion-Picture-Various-Artists/dp/B004PR71JC |publisher=Amazon.com |accessdate=September 16, 2011}} In the Brazilian edition some songs gained a [[Portuguese language|Portuguese]] version performed by famous Brazilian artists such [[Ivete Sangalo]] (replacing Ester Dean in "Take You to Rio (Remix)") and Carlinhos Brown (replacing Jamie Foxx in "Fly Love"). "Real in Rio" became "Favo de Mel" (Honeycomb) but it was performed by the same artists as the English version.{{cite web |title=Rio – Trilha Sonora Original |url=http://www.saraiva.com.br/rio-trilha-sonora-do-filme-3430152.html/?ID=BD00ED727DB061E0B092F0166 |work=Saraiva.com.br |accessdate=September 16, 2011}}{{cite web |title=Ivete Sangalo sings in the movie Rio soundtrack |url=http://www.ivetesangalo.com/en/2011/05/09/ivete-sangalo-grava-musica-para-trilha-sonora-do-filme-rio |work=Ivete Sangalo |accessdate=September 16, 2011 |date=May 9, 2011}} ====Charts==== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! Chart (2011) ! Peak
position |- | US [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]]{{cite web |url=http://www.hitsdailydouble.com/sales/salescht.cgi |title=Building Album Sales Chart |work=HITS Daily Double |accessdate=2012-08-07}} | style="text-align:center;"|60 |- | US [[Digital Albums]] | style="text-align:center;"|10 |- | US ''Billboard'' [[Top R&B/Hip-Hop Albums]] | style="text-align:center;"|6 |- | US ''Billboard'' [[Top Rap Albums]] | style="text-align:center;"|2 |- | US [[Kid Albums]] | style="text-align:center;"|8 |- | US Soundtracks | style="text-align:center;"|4 |} ===Score=== {{Infobox album | name = Rio | type = Film | artist = [[John Powell (film composer)|John Powell]] | cover = | border = yes | alt = The word "RIO" in blue, yellow, and orange letters, with the "R" styled to resemble a bird's head. | released = {{Start date|2011|04|19}} | recorded = | venue = | studio = | genre = [[Film score|Score]] | length = {{Duration|m=47|s=04}} | label = [[Varèse Sarabande]] | producer = | chronology = [[John Powell (composer)|John Powell]] film scores | prev_title = [[Mars Needs Moms]] | prev_year = 2011 | next_title = [[Kung Fu Panda 2 (soundtrack)|Kung Fu Panda 2]] | next_year = 2011 }} The [[film score]] of ''Rio'' was composed by [[John Powell (composer)|John Powell]] and was released on April 19, 2011, by [[Varèse Sarabande Records]].{{cite web |url=https://itunes.apple.com/us/album/rio-original-motion-picture/id429214902 |title=Rio (Original Motion Picture Score) |work=iTunes |accessdate=April 22, 2011}}{{cite news |url=http://filmmusicreporter.com/2011/03/24/rio-score-album-details |accessdate=April 22, 2011 |title='Rio' Score Album Details |newspaper=Film Music Reporter |date=March 24, 2011}} ==Release== The world premiere of ''Rio'' took place on March 22, 2011, at a [[Cinépolis]] theater in [[Lagoa, Rio de Janeiro]].{{cite news |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/films/animated-3d-film-rio-premieres-in-brazil-favela-2254194.html |title=Animated 3D film 'Rio' premieres in Brazil favela |work=The Independent |location=UK |date=March 26, 2011 |accessdate=June 1, 2011}} The United States premiere was on April 10, 2011, at [[Grauman’s Chinese Theatre]] in Hollywood, California, and was released throughout the country five days later.{{cite news |url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2011/04/11/last-weekends-events-_n_847623.html |title=Last Weekend's Events: A Red Tie Affair, 'Rio' Premiere, and GLAAD Media Awards |work=Huffington Post |location=USA |date=April 11, 2011 |accessdate=June 1, 2011 |first=Nicole |last=Larson}} Since May 2009, it had been scheduled to be released in the United States on April 8, 2011, but in December 2010, it was rescheduled a week later to April 15, 2011.{{cite press release|author1=Twentieth Century Fox|title=New Blue Sky Animated Feature Film Announced “RIO” Opens April 8, 2011|url=http://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20090512006239/en/Blue-Sky-Animated-Feature-Film-Announced-%E2%80%9CRIO%E2%80%9D|publisher=Business Wire|accessdate=April 17, 2017|date=May 12, 2009}}{{cite web|title=New Dates & Changes|url=http://www.boxofficemojo.com:80/schedule/?view=changes&p=.htm|publisher=Box Office Mojo|accessdate=April 17, 2017|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20101225053335/http://www.boxofficemojo.com/schedule/?view=changes&p=.htm|archivedate=December 25, 2010|deadurl=yes|df=mdy-all}} [[Pixar|Pixar Animation Studios]] cancelled the release of their planned 2012 film ''Newt'' because of the similarity of its plotline to ''Rio''.{{cite web |url=http://movies.ign.com/articles/116/1165409p1.html |title=Pixar on Newt: Blame It on Rio? |work=IGN |author=Vejvoda, Jim |accessdate=May 2, 2011 |date=May 2, 2011}} ===Marketing=== In April 2011, Oreo announced its special edition Oreo cookies with blue cream in promotion of the film. The promotion included stickers inside each package of cookies. Two types of contest were also announced: first, by completing an album of stickers, consumers could win three movie passes and medium snack bar combos; second, by finding winning stickers in packages with prizes including a trip to Rio de Janeiro, backpacks, cinema passes for a year, and 3D glasses. The promotion ended on May 30, 2011.{{cite news |title=Concurso Promo Oreo, gana paquetes de cine, viaje a Rio, mochilas y más |url=http://www.pe.promogana.net/2011/04/concurso-promo-oreo-gana-paquetes-de.html |accessdate=September 16, 2011 |newspaper=Promo Gana – Perú |date=April 8, 2011}} The promotion is available in Ecuador, Peru, and Colombia.{{Citation needed|date=August 2012}} On January 27, 2011, [[Rovio Entertainment|Rovio Mobile]] announced a partnership with [[20th Century Fox]] to promote the film. The game ''[[Angry Birds Rio]]'' was released in March 2011 on the [[Android Market]] and the [[Apple Inc.|Apple]] [[App Store (iOS)|App Store]] with 50 levels. Rovio released more levels throughout 2011.{{cite news |last=Warne |first=Alex |title=Angry Birds Going Big Time |url=http://dailynewspulse.com/angry-birds-going-big-time/222346 |accessdate=September 16, 2011 |newspaper=Daily News Pulse |date=January 29, 2011}} With the DVD and Blu-ray release, Rovio and 20th Century Fox announced that they were going to start selling Rio Plush Toys in the Angry Birds Online Store and the DVD and Blu-ray comes with a code for 15 Hidden Levels, along with 3 Angry Birds Rio Videos. Also, [[McDonald's]] ran a promotion with Rio toys in their Happy Meals.{{cite web |last=Team |first=Angry Birds |title=RIO plush toys and DVD wing their way into stores! |url=http://www.rovio.com/index.php?mact=Blogs,cntnt01,showentry,0&cntnt01entryid=78&cntnt01returnid=58 |work=Angry Birds Rio |accessdate=August 3, 2011}} In February 2011, the [[Motion Picture Association of America|MPAA]] gave the film a PG rating for "mild off-color humor". The producers, displeased by this rating, resubmitted an edited version of the film to the ratings board one month later, and the MPAA changed the film to a G rating.{{cite news |last=Subers |first=Ray |title=MPAA Ratings: 'Kung Fu Panda 2,' 'Rio,' 'Arthur' and More |url=http://www.boxofficemojo.com/news/?id=3115&p=.htm |accessdate=September 15, 2011 |newspaper=Box Office Mojo |publisher=IMDb |date=March 15, 2011}} ===Home media=== As a tribute to the country where most of the story is set and where the director was born, ''Rio'' was first released for home video in Brazil, on both DVD and [[Blu-ray]], on July 7, 2011.{{cite news |title=Coletiva de imprensa com Carlos Saldanha no Rio de Janeiro |url=https://www.facebook.com/notes/cinnamon-comunica%C3%A7%C3%A3o/coletiva-de-imprensa-com-carlos-saldanha-no-rio-de-janeiro/238908306137596 |accessdate=July 16, 2011 |author=Comunicação, Cinnamon |date=July 4, 2011 |language=Portuguese}} The North American release date was August 2, 2011,{{cite news |title=Rio Hits Blu-ray and DVD on August 2 |url=http://www.comingsoon.net/news/movienews.php?id=78672 |accessdate=June 17, 2011 |work=ComingSoon.net |date=June 15, 2011}} and the Australian release date was September 28, 2011.{{cite web|last1=Podmore|first1=Scott|title=Lively time in vibrant Rio|url=http://www.heraldsun.com.au/travel/world/lively-time-in-vibrant-rio/news-story/b71366769950e784e9a729487a61d2cb?nk=06baba470b40b5097ac4494c88badc1e-1482776615|website=The Herald Sun|accessdate=26 December 2016}} As of June 2014, a total of 12 million Blu-ray and DVD units had been sold worldwide.{{cite news|last1=Graser|first1=Marc|title=Fox Takes Digital Retail Partners on Road for ‘Rio 2′|url=https://variety.com/2014/film/news/fox-takes-digital-retail-partners-on-road-for-rio-2-1201246717/|accessdate=June 30, 2014|work=Variety|date=June 25, 2014}} ''Rio'' is available in 4 different packages: a 4-disc "Party Edition" combination package (3D Blu-ray, Blu-ray, DVD, and Digital Copy), a 3-disc "Party Edition" combination package (Blu-ray, DVD, and Digital Copy), a 2-disc "Party Edition" combination package (DVD and Digital Copy), and a single disc DVD.{{cite news |last=Gallagher |first=Brian |title=Rio Blu-ray and DVD Arrive August 2nd |url=http://www.movieweb.com/news/rio-blu-ray-and-dvd-arrive-august-2nd |accessdate=June 17, 2011 |work=MovieWeb.com |date=June 15, 2011}} The "Digital Copy" included with the 3-disc combination package is a separate disc that allows users to download a copy of the film to a computer through [[iTunes]] or [[Windows Media Player]] software. The 3-disc combination package also comes with an hour of bonus features.{{cite news |last=Katz |first=Josh |title=Rio Blu-ray |url=http://www.blu-ray.com/news/?id=6676 |accessdate=June 17, 2011 |date=June 15, 2011}} ===Video games=== A video game based on the film was released on April 12, 2011, for the [[Wii]], [[Nintendo DS]], [[PlayStation 3]], and the [[Xbox 360]].{{cite web |title=Rio by THQ |url=http://www.gamestop.com/xbox-360/games/rio/90273 |work=Rio |accessdate=July 14, 2011}} Another game, ''[[Angry Birds Rio]]'', was released in March 2011 for various mobile and desktop systems.{{cite web|url=http://www.pcworld.com/article/218181/angry_birds_rio_release_teams_with_hollywood.html|title='Angry Birds Rio' Release Teams With Hollywood|author=Paul Suarez|work=PCWorld.com|date=2011-01-29|accessdate=2011-02-04| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20110205124337/http://www.pcworld.com/article/218181/angry_birds_rio_release_teams_with_hollywood.html| archivedate=February 5, 2011 | deadurl= no}} ==Rio: The 4-D Experience== ''Rio: The 4-D Experience'' is a 12-minute [[4D film]] shown at various 4-D theatres over the world. Produced by [[SimEx-Iwerks]], it premiered on September 27, 2013 at the [[San Diego Zoo]] 4-D Theater.{{cite web|url=http://www.sandiegozoo.org/rio/|title=Rio The 4-D Experience|website=San Diego Zoo}} Since May 24, 2014, it is being shown at the 5D Cinema at the revived [[Kentucky Kingdom]]. Since July 2014, it is being shown at the 4D Special FX Theater at [[Moody Gardens]].{{cite web|url=http://www.moodygardens.com/attractions/4d_special_fx_theater/4d_schedule/|title=Virtual Reality Theater - 4D Special FX Theater - Interactive Movie Theater - Special Effects Theaters|website=www.moodygardens.com}} And since October 25, 2014, it is being shown at the [[Roxy Theatre (Warner Bros. Movie World)|Roxy Theatre]] at [[Warner Bros. Movie World]].movieworld.com.au/rides-and-attractions/family-entertainment/rio-4d.aspx ==Reception== ===Box office=== ''Rio'' made $143,619,809 in North America, along with $341,015,951 in other territories for a total of $484,635,760 worldwide, becoming the 13th highest-grossing film of 2011{{cite web |title=2011 WORLDWIDE GROSSES |url=http://boxofficemojo.com/yearly/chart/?view2=worldwide&yr=2011&p=.htm |work=Box Office Mojo |publisher=IMDb |accessdate=April 23, 2012}} and the 107th highest-grossing film of all time.{{cite web |url=http://boxofficemojo.com/movies/?id=rio.htm |title=Rio (2011) |work=Box Office Mojo |publisher=IMDb |accessdate=September 2, 2011}} It was the first film of 2011 to pass the $400-million mark. ====North America==== ''Rio'' debuted with $39,225,962 during its opening weekend on approximately 6,400 screens at 3,826 theaters. It ranked No. 1 at the box office surpassing the other new wide release, ''[[Scream 4]]'', which ranked #2.{{cite news |url=http://boxofficemojo.com/news/?id=3142&p=.htm |title=Weekend Report: 'Rio' Leads, 'Scream' Bleeds |first=Brandon |last=Gray |publisher=IMDb |work=Box Office Mojo |date=April 17, 2011 |accessdate=April 18, 2011}} This was the highest-grossing opening weekend of 2011 that far, finishing the year at sixteenth.{{cite web |url=http://boxofficemojo.com/yearly/chart/?view2=opening&yr=2011&p=.htm |title=2011 OPENING GROSSES |publisher=IMDb |work=Box Office Mojo |accessdate=April 18, 2011}} It also scored the largest opening weekend in April for an animated feature, and the sixth largest in April overall.{{cite web |url=http://boxofficemojo.com/alltime/weekends/month/?mo=04&p=.htm |title=TOP OPENING WEEKENDS BY MONTH |publisher=IMDb |work=Box Office Mojo |accessdate=June 8, 2011}} On its second weekend (Easter weekend) it retained first place at the box office, dropping only 33% to $26.3 million, therefore surpassing that weekend's releases, Tyler Perry's ''[[Madea's Big Happy Family (film)|Madea's Big Happy Family]]'' ($25.1 million), ''[[Water for Elephants (film)|Water for Elephants]]'' ($16.8 million), and ''[[African Cats]]'' ($6 million), which ranked second, third, and sixth, respectively.{{cite web |url=http://boxofficemojo.com/weekend/chart/?view=&yr=2011&wknd=16&p=.htm |title=April 22–24, 2011 Weekend |publisher=IMDb |work=Box Office Mojo |accessdate=April 18, 2011}} ''Rio''{{'}}s income of $143.6 million made it Blue Sky's second lowest box office result at the time, surpassing only ''[[Robots (2005 film)|Robots]]'',{{cite web|url=http://boxofficemojo.com/news/?id=3165&p=.htm|title=Animation Deceptively Strong So Far in 2011 - Box Office Mojo|website=boxofficemojo.com}} and the 18th highest grossing film of the year in North America.{{cite web|url=http://boxofficemojo.com/yearly/chart/?yr=2011&p=.htm|title=2011 Yearly Box Office Results - Box Office Mojo|website=boxofficemojo.com}} ====Other territories==== On its first weekend overseas (the weekend before its release in North America) it topped the box office with $54.9 million from 11,714 screens in 72 countries.{{cite news |url=http://boxofficemojo.com/news/?id=3136&p=.htm |title=Around-the-World Roundup: 'Rio' Livens Up Foreign Box Office |first=Ray |last=Subers |publisher=IMDb |work=Box Office Mojo |date=April 13, 2011 |accessdate=April 25, 2011}} On its second weekend it earned $55.4 million, still on top of the overseas box office{{cite news |url=http://boxofficemojo.com/news/?id=3144&p=.htm |title=Around-the-World Roundup: 'Rio' Continues to Soar Overseas |first=Ray |last=Subers |publisher=IMDb |work=Box Office Mojo |date=April 17, 2011 |accessdate=April 25, 2011}} and on its third weekend it remained at the summit of the box office, grossing an estimated $44.3 million. It therefore marked the second film that succeeded in topping the overseas box office three times in 2011, joining ''[[Tangled]]'', although it is the only one that did it on three consecutive weekends.{{cite news |url=http://boxofficemojo.com/news/?id=3147&p=.htm |title=Around-the-World Roundup: 'Rio' Reigns Again, 'Fast Five,' 'Thor' Duke It Out in Australia |first=Ray |last=Subers |publisher=IMDb |work=Box Office Mojo |date=April 26, 2011 |accessdate=April 27, 2011}} In Brazil, the film's main setting and Saldanha's homeland, ''Rio'' was the largest release ever with over 1,000 screens.{{cite web|title=Fox confirma estreia recorde de "Rio" no Brasi|url=http://ultimosegundo.ig.com.br/cultura/cinema/fox+confirma+estreia+recorde+de+rio+no+brasil/n1300033422291.html|publisher=Ultimo Segundo|accessdate=March 31, 2014|date=April 7, 2011}} Its opening weekend gross of $8.4 million was the biggest ever for an American film{{cite news |url=http://boxofficemojo.com/news/?id=3136&p=.htm |title=Around-the-World Roundup: 'Rio' Livens Up Foreign Box Office |first=Ray |last=Subers |publisher=IMDb |work=Box Office Mojo |date=April 13, 2011 |accessdate=April 18, 2011}} (surpassed one year later by ''[[Madagascar 3: Europe's Most Wanted]]''). On its second weekend it earned $7.2 million, falling just 14% from its opening. It then delivered the highest-grossing third weekend in history with $6.3 million (a 12% decline).{{cite news |url=http://boxofficemojo.com/news/?id=3147&p=.htm |title=Around-the-World Roundup: 'Rio' Reigns Again, 'Fast Five,' 'Thor' Duke It Out in Australia |first=Brandon |last=Gray |publisher=IMDb |work=Box Office Mojo |date=April 26, 2011 |accessdate=May 4, 2011}} ''Rio'' finished 2011 with a final gross of $36.8 million (R$68.7 million), the second highest income of the year after ''[[The Twilight Saga: Breaking Dawn – Part 1]]''.{{cite web |url=http://oca.ancine.gov.br/media/SAM/Informes/2011/Informe_Anual_2011.pdf |title=INFORME DE ACOMPANHAMENTO DO MERCADO: Filmes e Bilheterias, Resultados de 2011 |publisher=Ancine|language=Portuguese|format=PDF|page=6|date=January 11, 2012|accessdate=March 30, 2014}} In [[Russia]] and the [[Commonwealth of Independent States|CIS]], it topped the box office with $11.3 million during its opening weekend (including weekday previews), surpassing ''Tangled'' for the largest all-time opening of a non-sequel animated feature. It earned $24.7 million in total, marking the fourth largest animated film of all time.{{cite web |url=http://www.boxofficemojo.com/intl/cis/yearly |title=Russia Box Office |publisher=IMDb |work=Box Office Mojo |accessdate=June 8, 2011}} In [[Venezuela]], it has earned $8 million, marking the second-highest-grossing film of all time behind ''Ice Age 3'' ($11.6 million).{{cite web |url=http://boxofficemojo.com/intl/venezuela/yearly/?yr=2011&p=.htm |title=Venezuela Yearly Box Office |publisher=IMDb |work=Box Office Mojo |accessdate=June 16, 2011}} In [[Uruguay]], it is the fourth highest-grossing film of all time with $754,820 after ''[[Titanic (1997 film)|Titanic]]'' ($2.1 million), ''[[Avatar (2009 film)|Avatar]]'' ($1.1 million), and ''Ice Age 3'' ($1 million).{{cite web |url=http://boxofficemojo.com/intl/uruguay/yearly/?yr=2011&p=.htm |title=Uruguay Yearly Box Office |publisher=IMDb |work=Box Office Mojo |accessdate=June 16, 2011}} In [[Peru]], grossing $3.8 million, it is the third-largest animated feature behind ''Ice Age 3'' and ''[[Shrek Forever After]]'', and the fourth highest-grossing film of all time behind these two and ''Avatar''.{{cite web |url=http://boxofficemojo.com/intl/peru/yearly/?yr=2011&p=.htm |title=Peru Yearly Box Office |publisher=IMDb |work=Box Office Mojo |accessdate=June 16, 2011}} In [[India]], it grossed {{INR}}10,000,000 in three weeks making the biggest animated opener ever.{{cite web |url=http://www.boxofficeindia.co.in/rio-rises-to-greater-heights |title=Rio gets to Greater heights |publisher=Box Office India |accessdate=August 29, 2011}} ===Critical response=== {{Anchor|Critics}} ''Rio'' received positive reviews from film critics. The [[review aggregator]] [[Rotten Tomatoes]] gives the film a 71% rating based on 147 reviews, with an average rating of 6.4/10. The website's consensus is: "This straightforward movie hits great heights thanks to its colorful visual palette, catchy music, and perfect vocal performances." On [[Metacritic]], which assigns a normalized rating out of 100 to reviews from mainstream critics, the film has an average score of 63 out of 100, indicating "generally favorable reviews".{{cite web |url=http://www.metacritic.com/movie/rio |title=Rio |work=[[Metacritic]] |publisher=[[CBS Interactive]] |accessdate=April 15, 2011}} [[Owen Gleiberman]] of ''[[Entertainment Weekly]]'' gave the film a mixed "C" rating. Gleiberman praised the animation in ''Rio'' and its music, and later went on to say that the film is "less a Pixar-level pleasure than a busy, frantic, and overstuffed dessert of a movie."{{cite web |url=http://www.ew.com/ew/article/0,,20481533,00.html |title=Rio |last=Gleiberman |first=Owen |work=Entertainment Weekly |accessdate=April 13, 2011}} Betsy Sharkey of the ''[[Los Angeles Times]]'' gave a positive review and praised the film for its comic action and the voices, as well as the visuals.{{cite news |url=http://articles.latimes.com/2011/apr/15/entertainment/la-et-rio-20110415 |title='Rio' review |last=Sharkey |first=Betsy |work=Los Angeles Times |date=April 15, 2011 |accessdate=May 20, 2011}} ===Accolades=== {| class="wikitable sortable" width="99%" |- style="background:#ccc; vertical-align:bottom;" ! colspan="4" style="background: LightSteelBlue;" | List of awards and nominations |- style="background:#ccc; text-align:center;" ! Award ! Category ! Recipient(s) and nominee(s) ! Result |- style="border-top:2px solid gray;" |- |- | [[84th Academy Awards]] | [[Academy Award for Best Original Song|Best Original Song]], "Real in Rio" | [[Sérgio Mendes]]
[[Carlinhos Brown]]
[[Siedah Garrett]] | rowspan=2 {{Nom}} |- | style="border-top:10px black" rowspan="8" | [[Annie Award]]s | [[Annie Award for Best Animated Feature|Best Animated Feature]] | Bruce Anderson
John C. Donkin |- | rowspan="2" | [[Annie Award#Individual achievement|Best Character Animation in an Animated Production]] | Jeff Gabor | {{Won}} |- | Patrik Puhala | rowspan=11 {{Nom}} |- | [[Annie Award#Individual achievement|Best Character Design in a Feature Production]] | Sergios Pablos |- | [[Annie Award#Individual achievement|Directing in an Animated Feature Production]] | [[Carlos Saldanha]] |- | [[Annie Award#Individual achievement|Best Music in an Animated Feature Production]] | Mikael Mutti

''TV by the Numbers''. Retrieved August 25, 2012. | rowspan="2" | Favorite Movie Animated Voice | rowspan="2" | [[Anne Hathaway]] |- | [[2011 Teen Choice Awards]]{{cite news |title=Teen Choice Awards Nominees – 2011 List |url=http://www.nationalledger.com/pop-culture-news/teen-choice-awards-nominees-113674.shtml |accessdate=July 1, 2011 |newspaper=The National Ledger |date=June 29, 2011}} |- | [[2012 Kids' Choice Awards]] | Favorite Animated Movie ! |- | [[38th Saturn Awards]] | Best Animated Film ! |- |[[10th Visual Effects Society Awards]]{{cite web|url=https://www.visualeffectssociety.com/ayear/10th-annual-ves-awards|title=10th Annual VES Awards|work=visual effects society|accessdate=December 31, 2017}} |Outstanding Animated Character in an Animated Feature Motion Picture | Diana Diriwaechter, Sang Jun Lee, Sergio Pablos, Aamir Tarin |} ==Sequel== {{Main|Rio 2}} A sequel, titled ''[[Rio 2]]'', was released on April 11, 2014. Carlos Saldanha, the creator and director of the first film, returned as director. All the main cast, including Anne Hathaway, Jesse Eisenberg, Jemaine Clement, Jamie Foxx, will.i.am, Tracy Morgan, George Lopez, Jake T. Austin, Leslie Mann, and Rodrigo Santoro, reprised their roles. New cast includes [[Andy García]], [[Bruno Mars]], [[Kristin Chenoweth]], [[Rita Moreno]], [[Amandla Stenberg]], [[Rachel Crow]], [[Pierce Gagnon]], and [[Natalie Morales (journalist)|Natalie Morales]]. The sequel follows Blu, Jewel and their three kids on a venture into the [[Amazon rainforest|Amazon]] where they try to live like real birds. Eventually, they find Jewel's long-lost father Eduardo, who is in hiding with a tribe of other [[Spix's macaw]]. At first everything seems perfect, but Blu is having trouble adapting to the wild. Eventually, they discover that the Amazon is under threat, and that Blu and Jewel's old nemesis, Nigel the cockatoo, is back for revenge.{{cite web|url=http://blueskystudios.com/blog/entry/official-rio2-casting-press-release/ |title=Twentieth Century Fox Animation Announces Rio 2 Casting |publisher=Blue Sky Studios |date=February 22, 2013 |accessdate=February 22, 2013}} ==References== {{Reflist|refs= {{cite news | url=http://www.variety.com/article/VR1118003473 | title=Fox, Blue Sky drawn to 'Rio' | last=Siegel | first=Tatiana | date=May 11, 2009 | work=Variety | accessdate=January 20, 2010}} {{cite web | url=http://www.cinemablend.com/new/Neil-Patrick-Harris-Takes-Anne-Hathaway-To-Rio-15351.html | title=Neil Patrick Harris Takes Anne Hathaway To Rio | last=Gomez | first=Tim | date=October 22, 2009 | work=Cinema Blend | accessdate=January 20, 2010}} {{cite news | last=Azevedo | first=Erika | the animation 'Rio' | language=Portuguese | work=O Globo | date=March 22, 2011 | accessdate=March 27, 2011}} {{cite news | url=http://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/rio | title=Rio | work=Rotten Tomatoes | revision.text:
{{Other uses|State of War (disambiguation)}} {{Infobox video game |developer = [[Cypron Studios]]
[[Cinemax (video game developer)|Cinemax]] |publisher = [[Crystal Interactive]] |genre = [[Real-time strategy]] |released = 2001 |modes = [[Singleplayer]], [[Multiplayer video game|multiplayer]] |platforms = [[Microsoft Windows|Windows]] }} '''State of War''' is a [[real-time strategy]] game, developed by [[Cypron Studios]] and [[Cinemax (video game developer)|Cinemax]] and published by [[Crystal Interactive]] in 2001. See also [[State of War web game]] for the web based game released in 2008. == Story == This description is told by narrator at the beginning of the game. After centuries of continuous struggles, war and turmoil; humankind finally came together and founded the ''United Federation of Seven Continents (UFSC)''. It was decided that every member of the Federation would provide their armed forces to build a single military unit with the goal to protect the Earth and settle eventual conflicts. Thus it was no longer possible for any individual group to use military force to resolve their personal aim. Within several years, the Federation created a Global Defense Network, known as "Overmind". Actually, it was a super intelligent mainframe computer - a unique work of hundreds of the most gifted scientists on the planet. It was operated by an intelligent software and consisted of 22 military bases worldwide located far from populated areas ready to act in case of the conflict. Since then, no machinery was ever controlled by man. Only the formal approval to activate "Overmind" had to be given by each UFSC representative. Global society, however, carried its burdens. People suffering from spiritual emptiness sought refuge in organizations that offered salvation. The most influential among them was the ''Beho-Sunns''. Charismatic leaders of the cult used their personal charm and rhetorical skills to attract more and more people. Their audience included every social group from workers, scienties, lawyers to elite politicians. Behind it all, there was the wicked plan to get hold of "Overmind". None of the Beho-Sunns followers knew that during their meditation seasons the cult gathered all kinds of information from their minds. Over years, the Beho-Sunns discovered much about Overmind's mechanics and were able to hack the software which controls Overmind. It so happened that the Beho-Sunns leaders tried to hack Overmind, but due to sophisticated [[Firewall (computing)|firewall]] protection, they failed. Consequences were fatal. The Global Defense System went out of order and malfunctioned. Members of the Beho-Sunns quickly recovered from their defeat and started occupying defenseless military bases. Their actions must be halted! To do so, the UFSC have declared a [[war|state of war]]. ==Sequels== A sequel titled ''State of War: Warmonger'' was released. Designed as a stand-alone version, the game includes 16 new missions in which 11 are single-player and 5 multiplayer.http://www.cypronia.com/pc In 2007 a spiritual successor titled ''State of War 2: Arcon'' was released in the Czech Republic, Slovakiahttp://www.cypronia.com/pc and Russia.http://ru.akella.com/Game.aspx?id=436 In 2008 a Nintendo DS game titled ''Command and Destroy'' was releasedhttp://www.nintendo.com/games/detail/1_T5VbpgZxMi3Og5-VBmBbXGCjgcvF65#game-details featuring similar visual and real-time strategy design. It was met with mixed reception from criticshttp://www.metacritic.com/game/ds/command-and-destroy and ''GameZone'''s review stated that is a "half-decent effort that doesn't live up to the legacy created by the game it mimics",http://www.gamezone.com/reviews/command_destroy_nds_review referencing the similarly titled ''[[Command & Conquer]]''. === Note: The domain names of http://www.cypron-studios.com And http://www.stateofwar2.com have expired. The official website is http://www.cypronia.com=== ==References== == External links == *[http://www.v-direct.org.uk/StateOfWar.htm About State of War game] *[http://www.cypronia.com/pc State of War in Cypronia official link] *[http://stateofwar.funsite.cz/ State of war Fan site ] *[http://blog.stateofwar.cn/ State of War Fan site - English Blog ] *[http://www.stateofwar.cn/ State of War Game Theme Website - Chinese Website] [[Category:2001 video games]] [[Category:Real-time strategy video games]] [[Category:Science fiction video games]] [[Category:Windows games]] [[Category:Windows-only games]] [[Category:Video games developed in Slovakia]] [[Category:Video games developed in the Czech Republic]]
